description: This trail starts at the Sibbald Lake TH and progresses either across the Interpretive Trail or back on the road and around the hill.The Deer Ridge hike climbs up above the meadow and reaches and elevation of 1710 meters before the trail moves down an old cut line and back to the Eagle Hills trail at 4.5 KM out.The Eagle Hills undulates upward to an elevation of 1745 meters at the reserve fence line.The return trip follows the Eagle Hill trail back to Sibbald Lake.
directions: From Highway 1, between Calgary & Banff take highway 68 west to the Sibbald Lake exit on right.
title: Deer Ridge- Eagle Hills Loop
